description: Interstellar is a 2014 epic science fiction drama film directed, written, and produced by Christopher Nolan.
excerpts: Interstellar is a 2014 epic science fiction drama film directed, written, and produced by Christopher Nolan and starring Matthew McConaughey, Anne Hathaway, Jessica Chastain, Bill Irwin, Ellen Burstyn, Michael Caine, and Matt Damon.
Interstellar premiered in Los Angeles on October 26, 2014. The film received positive reviews from critics and grossed over $681 million worldwide, making it the tenth highest-grossing film of 2014.
Matthew McConaughey as Joseph Cooper, a widower NASA pilot who reluctantly becomes a farmer after the agency was closed by the government and eventually joins the Endurance mission as the lead pilot.
Anne Hathaway as Dr. Amelia Brand, Professor Brand's daughter and NASA scientist who aboard the Endurance mission is responsible for conducting planet colonization.
Jessica Chastain as Murphy 'Murph' Cooper, Joseph's daughter who eventually becomes a NASA scientist working under Professor Brand.
Michael Caine as Professor John Brand, a high-ranking NASA scientist, father of Amelia, former mentor of Cooper, and director of the Lazarus and Endurance missions.
Matt Damon as Dr. Mann, a NASA astronaut sent to an icy planet during the Lazarus program.

description: Key filming locations for the movie
excerpts: Principal photography began in late 2013 and took place in Alberta, Iceland, and Los Angeles.
Filming locations included the Svínafellsjökull glacier and the town of Klaustur in Iceland.
Shooting also took place in Los Angeles, including the Westin Bonaventure Hotel and Suites, the Los Angeles Convention Center, and a private residence in Altadena, California.

description: Description of the spacecraft featured in the film
excerpts: Interstellar features three spacecraft: the Endurance, a Ranger, and a Lander.
The Endurance is a circular structure consisting of 12 capsules laid flat to mimic a clock, with different capsules serving different functions.
The Ranger is a spacecraft capable of entering and exiting planetary atmospheres.
The Lander transports the capsules with settling equipment to planetary surfaces.

description: Information about the visual effects in the film
excerpts: The visual effects company Double Negative, which worked on Inception, was brought back for Interstellar.
The film contained 850 visual effect shots, with 150 shots created in-camera using digital projectors and another 700 created in post-production.
Miniature effects were used for the spacecraft, with models of the Endurance, Ranger, and Lander created by Nathan Crowley in collaboration with New Deal Studios.

description: Details about the sound design in the film
excerpts: Gregg Landaker and Gary Rizzo were the film's audio engineers tasked with audio mixing, while sound editor Richard King supervised the process.
Christopher Nolan sought to mix the sound to take maximum advantage of theater equipment and paid close attention to designing the sound mix.
The film's soundtrack was composed by Hans Zimmer, who scored Nolan's previous films, and featured the use of the 1926 four-manual Harrison & Harrison organ of the Temple Church in London.

description: Information about the scientific accuracy of the film
excerpts: Kip Thorne, a theoretical physicist and Nobel laureate, served as a scientific consultant and executive producer regarding the concepts of wormholes and black holes.
Thorne worked on the equations that would enable tracing of light rays as they traveled through a wormhole or around a black hole.
The film aimed to adhere to established physical laws and incorporate wild speculations based on science rather than fiction.
